text: Chinese Wikipedia (Chinese: /) is the Chinese-language edition of Wikipedia. It started on May 11, 2001. The Chinese Wikipedia can show the same article in many different scripts, in both Simplified and Traditional Chinese. It is the 15th largest Wikipedia edition by article count. Chinese Wikipedia currently has articles.Special:Statistics - Retrieved July 14, 2016 == Basic information == === Name origin === In the English language, "Wikipedia" is a portmanteau word made by "Wiki" (A technology that allows many people to work together) and "encyclopedia". At first, "Wikipedia" did not have a Chinese name. The site was called "Zhongwen Wikipedia" (中文Wikipedia, Chinese Wikipedia). On October 21, 2003, Wikipedia's Chinese name "Weiji Baike" (维基百科/維基百科, meaning Weiji Encyclopedia) was decided by the Chinese wiki community (13 people voted).:zh:维基百科:Wikipedia的中文名 The pronunciation of "Weiji" is like the pronunciation of "Wiki". "Wei" (维/維) means rope that can link things or net. "Ji" (基) means basic, or base. So "Weiji Baike" means "the encyclopedia on the Internet that covers human's all basic knowledge". == Autoconfirmation == Unlike other Wikipedias, users who register an account on the Chinese Wikipedia need to make at least 50 edits and have an account for more than 7 days before being autoconfirmed, which allows the user to edit semi-protected pages.Information about being autoconfirmed on the Chinese Wikipedia - Retrieved January 2, 2010 ==List of countries wikipedia distributions== * Chinese Wikipedia ** China ** Hong Kong ** Macau ** Singapore ** Taiwan == References == == Other websites == * Chinese Wikipedia main page Category:Wikipedias Category:Websites established in 2002
title: Chinese Wikipedia
